questions.question: Which word could be used to describe a main theme of the myth?

choices.answer: Wisdom
Escape
Freedom
Fear

questions.question: Which statement best explains how the setting impacts the plot of the story?

choices.answer: Daedalus saw the air as a means of escape.
Daedalus was a gifted engineer and inventor.
Daedalus was imprisoned in a high tower.
Daedalus tried to escape to Crete but failed.

questions.question: "Daedalus was an ingenious artist and was not discouraged by his failures." The author's purpose for using this is to...

choices.answer: explain that Daedalus was a successful artist but afraid of failure
explain that Daedalus was a smart person but afraid of failure
expalin that Daedalus was a successful artist but easily discouraged
explain that Daedalus was a smart person who does not give up

questions.question: The last sentence of paragraph 3. What is the effect of this description of Icarus playing on the shore?

choices.answer: It shows the reader that Icarus did not help his father.
It shows that Icarus was a young boy who liked to play.
It shows that Icarus was happy to be on the island.
It shows that Icarus wanted to be an artist like his father.

questions.question: In paragraph 6, the author compares Icarus to a bird. The purpose of this comparison is to ...

choices.answer: foreshadow Icarus's inability to fly
foreshadow Icarus's wings coming off
foreshadow Icarus's love for his father
foreshadow Icarus's joy when he flies

questions.question: Which detail from the story supports the key idea that Icarus flew too high?

choices.answer: Up and up Icarus soared ...
... until he reached the clouds ...
... the sun became so hot that the largest feathers dropped off ...
He cried out to his father ...

questions.question: Which two details from the story support the idea that a theme of the selection is independence?

choices.answer: He was bewitched by a sense of freedom...
...but he does not control the air...
Soon Icarus was sure that he, too, could fly...
...thrown caution to the winds in the exaltation of his freedom...

questions.question: Against his father's advice, Icarus flew higher and higher because he...

choices.answer: was overtaken by the thrill that came from flying freely
became lost when the sun blinded him
often disobeyed his father's commands
was eager to prove that he was stronger than his father

questions.question: Which sentence states an important theme in this myth?

choices.answer: Doing things with family members is always fun.
Being able to live in freedom is worth any cost.
Only true heroes can perform superhuman acts.
People must know their place in the universe.
Daedalus decides to build wings for them to use to escape the island.
Daedalus and Icarus become prisoners on the island.
Icarus tests his wings and flies just above the surface of the ocean.
Icarus tests his wings and flies just above the surface of the ocean.
Person Vs Person
Person VS Supernatural
Person VS Technology
Person VS Nature
Icarus flies too high, melting the wax on his wings; he falls.
Daedalus escapes but loses his son.
Daedalus cautions Icarus not to fly too high or too low.
Icarus gathers feathers, and Daedalus builds two sets of wings.

questions.question: Which sentence represents part of the rising action?

choices.answer: Daedalus and Icarus become prisoners on the island.
Icarus tests his wings and flies just above the surface of the ocean.
Daedalus escapes but loses his son.
Daedalus builds a temple to Apollo and hung up his wings as an offering.

questions.question: Which text evidence best supports the resolution?

choices.answer: He gathered the boy in his arms and flew to land ...
Small feathers fell from the wings ...
He arrived safely in Sicily ...
Frantically, he fluttered arms, but no feathers remained ...
